definitions: process of making something new, fresh, or strong again after deterioration
act of extending the validity period of a contract, license, or subscription
examples: The urban renewal project transformed the abandoned district
Spring brings a sense of renewal to nature and people alike
Your membership renewal is due at the end of this month
The lease renewal negotiations lasted for several weeks

definitions: process of repairing and improving a building or structure to restore it to good condition
examples: The historic hotel underwent extensive renovation over two years
Kitchen renovation can significantly increase your home's value

definitions: state of being famous and respected for achievements, skills, or qualities
examples: The artist achieved international renown for her innovative sculptures
Universities of great renown attract students from around the world

definitions: money paid regularly for the use of property or equipment
property or item that is rented out to others for temporary use
examples: The monthly rental for the apartment includes utilities
Equipment rental can be more economical than purchasing
We found a nice vacation rental near the beach
The car rental had unlimited mileage included

definitions: person who pays to use property or equipment owned by someone else
examples: The renter must provide a security deposit before moving in
As a renter, she had certain rights protected by law

definitions: practice or business of paying to use something owned by another person
examples: Renting an apartment gives you flexibility to move easily
The cost of renting has increased significantly this year

definitions: formal declaration of abandoning a claim, right, or possession, often for moral or spiritual reasons
examples: His renunciation of worldly possessions surprised his wealthy family
The treaty required the renunciation of all territorial claims

definitions: act of arranging things in a different sequence or purchasing replacement inventory
examples: The reordering of priorities helped the company focus better
Automatic reordering ensures we never run out of supplies

definitions: process of changing the structure or arrangement of an organization or system
examples: The company reorganisation resulted in three new departments
Financial reorganisation helped the firm avoid bankruptcy

definitions: process of changing the structure or arrangement of an organization or system
examples: The corporate reorganization streamlined operations across all divisions
Bankruptcy reorganization allowed the company to continue operating

definitions: process of changing focus, direction, or fundamental approach to something
examples: The strategic reorientation shifted focus from hardware to software
Cultural reorientation programs help expatriates adjust to new countries

definitions: person whose job is to fix broken equipment, appliances, or systems
examples: The repairman fixed our washing machine in under an hour
We called a repairman when the air conditioner stopped working

definitions: payment or action made to compensate for damage, injury, or wrongdoing, especially between nations
examples: The treaty demanded war reparations from the defeated nation
The company offered financial reparation for the environmental damage

definitions: person who returns to their country of origin after living abroad
examples: The repatriate struggled to readjust to life in her homeland
Many repatriates bring valuable international experience back home

definitions: process of returning someone to their country of origin or citizenship
examples: The refugee repatriation program helped thousands return home safely
Currency repatriation rules affect international business operations

definitions: act of paying back money that was borrowed or returning something equivalent
examples: Monthly loan repayment should not exceed thirty percent of income
The repayment schedule extends over fifteen years

definitions: official cancellation or reversal of a law, regulation, or policy
examples: Congress voted for the repeal of the controversial tax law
The repeal of prohibition ended thirteen years of alcohol ban

definitions: electronic device that receives and retransmits signals to extend range
person who repeats a course, grade, or action
examples: The wireless repeater extended internet coverage throughout the building
Install a repeater to boost the cellular signal
Several repeaters in the class needed extra tutoring support
He was a repeater who finally passed the exam

definitions: act of doing, saying, or producing something again or multiple times
examples: The repeating of instructions ensured everyone understood clearly
Constant repeating of the pattern created a hypnotic effect

definitions: chemical substance designed to keep away insects, animals, or water
examples: Apply insect repellent before hiking in the forest
The fabric has a water repellent coating for protection

definitions: deep regret or remorse for wrongdoing accompanied by commitment to change
examples: His genuine repentance moved the judge to reduce the sentence
Religious traditions often emphasize repentance and forgiveness

definitions: complete range of skills, works, or items that someone or something can produce
examples: The pianist's repertoire includes both classical and contemporary pieces
Expanding your cooking repertoire makes meal planning more interesting

definitions: system where a theater company performs multiple plays in rotation with the same performers
examples: The repertory theater presents six different plays each season
Acting in repertory provides diverse experience for performers

definitions: act of doing or saying something again, often for emphasis or practice
examples: Learning through repetition helps information stick in memory
The artistic repetition of shapes created a striking pattern

definitions: act of removing something and putting something else in its place
examples: Replacing old windows can significantly reduce energy costs
The replacing of senior staff created uncertainty in the department

definitions: broadcast or showing of something again, especially a recorded sports play
examples: The instant replay showed the referee made the correct call
Television networks often show replays of popular programs

definitions: act of filling something up again or restoring supplies to a former level
examples: Automatic inventory replenishment prevents stockouts in busy stores
The replenishment of groundwater takes many years

definitions: exact copy or model of something, especially one made on a smaller scale
examples: The museum displayed a replica of the ancient ship
This replica of the famous painting fooled many experts

definitions: process of copying or reproducing something exactly, especially in scientific experiments
examples: DNA replication is essential for cell division and growth
The replication of research results validates scientific findings

definitions: factual presentation of events in newspapers or broadcast media, emphasizing direct observation
examples: Her vivid reportage from the war zone won journalism awards
Modern reportage combines traditional reporting with multimedia elements

definitions: state of rest, sleep, or tranquility, often suggesting peaceful dignity
examples: The statue captured a moment of perfect repose
She found repose in the quiet garden after a stressful day

definitions: act of moving something to a different position or changing market strategy
examples: The brand reposition targeted younger consumers successfully
Quick reposition of troops gave them a tactical advantage

definitions: process of changing position, image, or market focus of a product or organization
examples: Market repositioning helped the company attract new customers
The repositioning of satellites requires precise calculations

definitions: place where things are stored or can be found, especially data or knowledge
examples: The university library serves as a repository of rare manuscripts
Online repositories make code sharing easy for developers

definitions: act of subduing someone or something by force, or unconsciously blocking unpleasant thoughts
examples: Political repression increased after the failed uprising
Psychological repression of trauma can affect mental health

definitions: temporary delay or cancellation of punishment, or relief from difficult circumstances
examples: The governor granted a last-minute reprieve to the prisoner
Rain brought a welcome reprieve from the summer heat

definitions: severe or formal criticism, especially from someone in authority
examples: The employee received a written reprimand for repeated tardiness
A verbal reprimand was sufficient to correct the behavior

definitions: new printing of a book or article, often unchanged from the original
examples: The popular textbook is now in its fifth reprint
Publishers ordered a reprint after the first edition sold out

definitions: act or business of printing something again, especially books or documents
examples: The reprinting of classic novels keeps them available to readers
Digital reprinting has made publishing more economically viable

definitions: act of retaliation or revenge, especially by one country against another
examples: Economic reprisals followed the breaking of the trade agreement
Fear of reprisal kept witnesses from testifying

definitions: expression of disappointment or criticism, or source of shame or disgrace
examples: Her voice carried a note of gentle reproach
Living beyond reproach requires consistent ethical behavior

definitions: quality of being able to be reproduced or replicated, especially important in scientific research
examples: Scientific reproducibility ensures that experiments yield consistent results
The study's reproducibility was questioned by peer reviewers

definitions: biological process by which organisms create offspring
copy or imitation of an original work or item
examples: Sexual reproduction increases genetic diversity in populations
Assisted reproduction technologies help many couples have children
This furniture reproduction captures the original's elegant style
High-quality art reproductions make masterpieces accessible

definitions: cold-blooded vertebrate animal with scaly skin that typically lays eggs
examples: Snakes and lizards are common reptiles in desert environments
The reptile exhibit features species from around the world

definitions: relating to reptiles or having qualities associated with reptiles
examples: His cold, reptilian stare made everyone uncomfortable
The reptilian brain controls basic survival instincts

definitions: political ideology supporting a republic form of government with elected representatives
examples: American republicanism emphasizes individual rights and limited government
The spread of republicanism challenged European monarchies

definitions: act of publishing something again, often with updates or in a new format
examples: The book's republication included a new introduction by the author
Digital republication makes out-of-print books available again

definitions: rejection or denial of the validity or authority of something or someone
examples: His public repudiation of extremist views restored his reputation
Contract repudiation can lead to legal consequences

definitions: act of driving back an attack or rejecting someone or something firmly
examples: The defenders' repulse of the invasion became legendary
Her cold repulse of his advances left him dejected

definitions: feeling of intense distaste or disgust, or force that pushes objects apart
examples: She felt immediate repulsion at the sight of cruelty
Magnetic repulsion keeps the train levitated above the track
